lazyft.config module¶

class lazyft.config.Config(path: Union[PathLike, str])[source]¶

Bases: object

A wrapper for a FreqTrade config file. Can be used like config[key] = value to get and set values.

copy() → Config[source]¶

Returns a temporary copy of the config

property data¶

Returns: A copy of the config data as a dict.

Saves the config to a file. The config will be saved to the ./config directory.

Parameters:

save_as – An optional path to save the config file to. Only include the file name, not the directory.

Returns:

The path to the saved config file.

lazyft.data_loader module¶

lazyft.data_loader.load_and_populate_pair_data(strategy_name: str, pair: str, timeframe: str, exchange='binance', timerange=None) → DataFrame[source]¶

Loads pair data, populates indicators, and returns the dataframe

Parameters:

  • strategy – The name of the strategy to use

  • pair – The pair to load data for

  • timeframe – The timeframe to load data for

  • exchange – The exchange to load data from, defaults to binance (optional)

  • timerange – A TimeRange object

Returns:

A dataframe with the populated data

lazyft.data_loader.load_pair_data(pair: str, timeframe: str, exchange='binance', timerange=None, startup_candles=0) → DataFrame[source]¶

Loads the pair from the exchange and returns a pandas dataframe

Parameters:

  • pair (str) – The pair to load

  • timeframe (str) – The timeframe to load

  • exchange – The exchange to load data from, defaults to binance (optional)

  • timerange – The timerange to load data for

Returns:

A DataFrame with the OHLCV data.”

lazyft.data_loader.load_pair_data_for_each_timeframe(pair: str, timerange: str, timeframes: list[str], column=None) → Union[DataFrame, dict[str, pandas.core.frame.DataFrame]][source]¶

Loads the data for a given pair, for each timeframe in the given list of timeframes, for the given timerange. If a column is specified, the data is returned as a DataFrame with the the approriate “{column}_{timeframe}” column for each dataframe.

Parameters:

  • pair – The pair you want to load data for

  • timerange – the range of time to load data for

  • timeframes – list of timeframes to load data for

  • column – the column to load data for.

Returns:

A list of dataframes

lazyft.downloader module¶

class lazyft.downloader.DownloadRecord(*, requested_start_date: datetime, actual_start_date: datetime, end_date: datetime)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

The DownloadRecord class is a model that defines the data to be stored in the database

actual_start_date: datetime¶
end_date: datetime¶
property reached_first_candle¶

Returns True if the last requested start date is the before or the same day as the actual start date. If this is True then the beginning of the pairs candle lifetime has been reached.

requested_start_date: datetime¶
class lazyft.downloader.History(*, history: dict[str, lazyft.downloader.DownloadRecord] = {})[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

A convenience class to for storing/retrieving the history of a pair.

lazyft.downloader.check_if_download_is_needed(exchange: str, pair: str, interval: str, requested_start_date: datetime, requested_end_date: Optional[datetime] = None) → bool[source]¶

Check if the pair is already downloaded.

Parameters:

  • exchange – Exchange name

  • pair – Pair name. Example: BTC/USDT

  • interval – Interval name

  • requested_start_date – Start date of the download

  • requested_end_date – End date of the download

Returns:

True if the pair needs to be downloaded

  • exchange – exchange to remove

  • interval – interval to remove

lazyft.downloader.download(config: Config, interval: str, days=None, pairs: Optional[list[str]] = None, timerange: Optional[str] = None, secrets_config=None, queue: Optional[Queue] = None)[source]¶
Args:

config: A config file object pairs: A list of pairs interval: The ticker interval. Default: 5m days: How many days worth of data to download timerange: Optional timerange parameter secrets_config: Optional secrets config file queue: Optional queue to put the data into

Returns: A queue that takes in output from the downloader

It iterates over the number of pairs, and downloads the data for each pair. It then updates the download history

Parameters:

  • queue – Queue to put the output into

  • start_date – The start date to download data for

  • n_pairs – The number of pairs to download

  • timeframes – The timeframes to download

  • exchange – The exchange to download from

It loads the data for the specified pair and interval from the specified exchange

Parameters:

  • pair (str) – The pair to get the time range for

  • interval (str) – The time interval between each data point

  • exchange (str) – The exchange to get the historical data for

A tuple of two datetime objects.

lazyft.loss_functions module¶

lazyft.loss_functions.roi_and_profit_hyperopt_loss(results: DataFrame, trade_count: int) → float[source]¶
lazyft.loss_functions.sharpe_hyperopt_loss(results: DataFrame, trade_count: int, days: int)[source]¶

Objective function, returns smaller number for more optimal results.

Uses Sharpe Ratio calculation.

lazyft.loss_functions.sortino_daily(results: DataFrame, trade_count: int, *args, **kwargs) → float[source]¶

Objective function, returns smaller number for more optimal results.

Uses Sortino Ratio calculation.

Sortino Ratio calculated as described in http://www.redrockcapital.com/Sortino__A__Sharper__Ratio_Red_Rock_Capital.pdf

lazyft.loss_functions.win_ratio_and_profit_ratio_loss(results: DataFrame, trade_count: int) → float[source]¶

Custom objective function, returns smaller number for better results

This function optimizes for both: best profit AND stability

On stability, the final score has an incentive, through ‘win_ratio’, to make more winning deals out of all deals done

This might prove to be more reliable for dry and live runs of FreqTrade and prevent over-fitting on best profit only

lazyft.pairlist module¶

lazyft.pairlist.refresh_pairlist(config: Config, n_coins: int, save_as=None, age_limit=7, **kwargs) → list[str][source]¶
Refresh the pairlist with the latest data from the exchange. Default settings are:

PriceFilter=True, AgeFilter=True, SpreadFilter=True, RangeStabilityFilter=True, VolatilityFilter=True

Parameters:

  • config – The original config to use settings from

  • n_coins – The number of coins to include in the pairlist

  • save_as – (optional) The name of the pairlist to save the new one as

  • age_limit – (optional) The age limit for the coins to include in the pairlist

  • kwargs – (optional) Any additional filters to apply to the pairlist

Returns:

The new pairlist

lazyft.strategy.create_temp_folder_for_strategy_and_params_from_backup(strategy_backup: StrategyBackup, hyperopt_id: int = None) → Path[source]¶

Creates a temporary folder that FreqTrade will run a backed-up strategy. If a hyperopt_id is provided, the parameters of the id will be loaded and exported to the same folder.

Parameters:

  • strategy_backup – The strategy backup to load the strategy from

  • hyperopt_id – The hyperopt parameters to load and save to the json file

The path to the new folder

lazyft.util.store_backtest_stats(recordfilename: Path, stats: dict[str, pandas.core.frame.DataFrame]) → Path[source]¶

Stores backtest results

Parameters:

recordfilename – Path object, which can either be a filename or a directory.

Filenames will be appended with a timestamp right before the suffix while for directories, <directory>/backtest-result-<datetime>.json will be used as filename :param stats: Dataframe containing the backtesting statistics

Returns:

Path object pointing to the file where the statistics were stored
